extensionDescription.message: Little button to save images and webms in one click or with any hotkeys. Praise cute!

settings_pathRestrictions_1.message: Save path MUST be relative to your downloads folder (you can check it on Tools -> Options -> General -> Downloads -> Save files to).

settings_pathRestrictions_2.message: E.g. if your downloads folder is "D:\Downloads", and you want this extension to save files in "D:\Downloads\pictures\dank-memes",

settings_pathRestrictions_4.message: Unfortunately, extensions can't save files outside of your downloads folder ("D:\Downloads" in our case).

settings_pathRestrictions_5.message: If you REALLY want to do that, look for "Symbolic links".

settings_defaultSavePath.message: Save files to (default location, used if no additional save paths specified):

settings_foldersRules_1.message:
All specified paths are relative to your browser save folder.
If you leave "save path" field empty, it will save files straight to it.
If you leave "filename" field empty, files will be saved with default filenames.
File extension will be set automatically, please don't specify it explicitly.
Using placeholders from the list below you can save files from each domain
in their own folders, or with some specific filenames.

List of available placeholders, must be surrounded with ::

settings_foldersRules_2.message:
You can choose mouse button or keyboard hotkey or both for each rule.

You can specify domain name if you want some rule to work only on this specific site.
You can also exclude hotkey for specific site, so it will work everywhere except this specific site.
To do this add domain name starting with "-" symbol.
You can get domain name either from address bar, or you can open
Web Console (Ctrl+Shift+K) and write document.location.hostname, the result will be
domain name you should insert into "domain name" field.
Rules with "domain name" have higher priority than "-domain name" rules.
Rules without domain name specified have lowest priority.

Examples:
wikipedia.org : this hotkey will only work on wikipedia.org
-twitter.com : this hotkey will work everywhere except twitter.com

settings_placeholdersList.message:
Domain name of the current site
Title of the current page
Board code if exists (e.g., b, vg)
Thread number if exists
Current date and time
Current date
UNIX timestamp
Default filename as assigned by browser
Original filename, available on most popular imageboards
Same as empty field, filename depending on mouse button pressed

settings_exclusions.message: CSS selectors for elements excluded from scanning (split by comma):

settings_domainExclusions.message: Newer show button on these sites (split by spaces):

settings_originalNameByDefault.message: Save to default location with original name if available (swaps LMB and RMB actions):

settings_saveFullSized.message: Always save full-sized images (works on twitter, tumblr, vk, instagram, iwara):

settings_checkByRealImageSize.message: Check naturalWidth first (sometimes helps with saving from previews)

settings_saveOnHover.message: Save on Ctrl+Alt+hover instead of click (recommended to use with "No duplicates" enabled):

settings_forbidDuplicateFiles.message: No duplicates (prevent saving of the same file multiple times):

settings_styleForSaveMark.message: Mark saved images with custom style:

settings_hideButton.message: Hide the button when not hovered:

settings_position.message: Button position (ignored when button placed under cursor):

settings_placeUnderCursor.message: Place button under cursor (can be toggled at any point with ESC)

settings_messageInvalidPath.message: Absolute paths are not allowed. Read the rules above.
